P.title: Will a Formula 1 Grand Prix be hosted in a country currently under international sanctions by 2025?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a Formula 1 Grand Prix is officially scheduled to take place in a country that is currently under international sanctions imposed by recognized authorities such as the United Nations, the European Union, or the United States. The term 'international sanctions' refers to restrictions imposed on a country by the international community, which may include trade restrictions, financial embargoes, and travel bans. The hosting of the Grand Prix must be confirmed by an official announcement from Formula 1 or the relevant governing body. If the event is canceled or relocated for any reason, this question will resolve as No. Temporary or unofficial races do not count towards this resolution.

Q.title: Will a Formula 1 Grand Prix be hosted in a country currently under international sanctions by 2030?
Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if a Formula 1 Grand Prix is hosted in a country currently under international sanctions by the end of 2030.

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) A Formula 1 Grand Prix is hosted in a country currently under international sanctions by 2025 (2) A Formula 1 Grand Prix is hosted in a country currently under international sanctions by 2030?
P_and_Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a Formula 1 Grand Prix is officially scheduled to take place in a country that is currently under international sanctions imposed by recognized authorities such as the United Nations, the European Union, or the United States, and if a Formula 1 Grand Prix is hosted in a country currently under international sanctions by the end of 2030. The term 'international sanctions' refers to restrictions imposed on a country by the international community, which may include trade restrictions, financial embargoes, and travel bans. The hosting of the Grand Prix must be confirmed by an official announcement from Formula 1 or the relevant governing body. If either event is canceled or relocated for any reason, this question will resolve as No. Temporary or unofficial races do not count towards this resolution.

P.title: Will a Formula 1 Grand Prix be hosted in a country currently under international sanctions by 2025?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a Formula 1 Grand Prix is officially scheduled to take place in a country that is currently under international sanctions imposed by recognized authorities such as the United Nations, the European Union, or the United States. The term 'international sanctions' refers to restrictions imposed on a country by the international community, which may include trade restrictions, financial embargoes, and travel bans. The hosting of the Grand Prix must be confirmed by an official announcement from Formula 1 or the relevant governing body. If the event is canceled or relocated for any reason, this question will resolve as No. Temporary or unofficial races do not count towards this resolution.

Q.title: Will the FIA change its regulations to allow races in countries under international sanctions by 2025?
Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if the FIA modifies its regulations to permit Formula 1 races in countries currently under international sanctions by the end of 2025.

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) A Formula 1 Grand Prix is hosted in a country currently under international sanctions by 2025, and (2) the FIA changes its regulations to allow races in countries under international sanctions by 2025?
P_and_Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, both of the following conditions are met: (1) a Formula 1 Grand Prix is officially scheduled to take place in a country that is currently under international sanctions imposed by recognized authorities such as the United Nations, the European Union, or the United States, confirmed by an official announcement from Formula 1 or the relevant governing body, and (2) the FIA modifies its regulations to permit Formula 1 races in countries currently under international sanctions.

P.title: Will a Formula 1 Grand Prix be hosted in a country currently under international sanctions by 2025?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a Formula 1 Grand Prix is officially scheduled to take place in a country that is currently under international sanctions imposed by recognized authorities such as the United Nations, the European Union, or the United States. The term 'international sanctions' refers to restrictions imposed on a country by the international community, which may include trade restrictions, financial embargoes, and travel bans. The hosting of the Grand Prix must be confirmed by an official announcement from Formula 1 or the relevant governing body. If the event is canceled or relocated for any reason, this question will resolve as No. Temporary or unofficial races do not count towards this resolution.

Q.title: Will a Formula 1 team be sponsored by a company based in a country under international sanctions by 2025?
Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if a Formula 1 team secures sponsorship from a company based in a country currently under international sanctions by the end of 2025.

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) A Formula 1 Grand Prix be hosted in a country currently under international sanctions by 2025 (2) A Formula 1 team be sponsored by a company based in a country under international sanctions by 2025?
P_and_Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a Formula 1 Grand Prix is officially scheduled to take place in a country that is currently under international sanctions imposed by recognized authorities such as the United Nations, the European Union, or the United States, and if a Formula 1 team secures sponsorship from a company based in a country currently under international sanctions by the end of 2025. The term 'international sanctions' refers to restrictions imposed on a country by the international community, which may include trade restrictions, financial embargoes, and travel bans. The hosting of the Grand Prix must be confirmed by an official announcement from Formula 1 or the relevant governing body. If the event is canceled or relocated for any reason, this question will resolve as No. Temporary or unofficial races do not count towards this resolution.

P.title: Will Ukraine join NATO before 2030?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, Ukraine is officially invited to join NATO and the invitation is accepted by the Ukrainian government. The invitation must be documented in an official NATO communiquÃ© or similar authoritative source. Additionally, the acceptance must be confirmed by a public statement from the President of Ukraine or the Ukrainian government. The resolution will also consider the status of Ukraine's membership in NATO if it has completed all necessary reforms and met the criteria for membership as outlined in NATO's Membership Action Plan. Any temporary or conditional invitations that do not lead to full membership by the specified date do not count towards a Yes resolution.

Q.title: Will Ukraine achieve full military interoperability with NATO forces by 2028?
Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Ukraine achieves full military interoperability with NATO forces as defined by the following criteria: 1. Ukraine's armed forces must be fully integrated into NATO command structures, allowing for joint operations and decision-making. 2. Ukraine must have adopted NATO standards for military equipment, logistics, and operational procedures, as verified by NATO assessments. 3. Joint military exercises involving NATO and Ukrainian forces must demonstrate the capability to operate seamlessly together in a range of scenarios. 4. This interoperability must be publicly acknowledged by NATO officials and documented in official NATO reports. In the absence of such documentation, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) confirming the achievement of interoperability will suffice.

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Will Ukraine join NATO before 2030? (2) Will Ukraine achieve full military interoperability with NATO forces by 2028?
P_and_Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Before January 1, 2030, Ukraine is officially invited to join NATO and the invitation is accepted by the Ukrainian government, documented in an official NATO communiqué or similar authoritative source, and confirmed by a public statement from the President of Ukraine or the Ukrainian government, with all necessary reforms completed and criteria for membership met as outlined in NATO's Membership Action Plan. (2) By December 31, 2028, Ukraine achieves full military interoperability with NATO forces, defined by: (a) Full integration of Ukraine's armed forces into NATO command structures for joint operations; (b) Adoption of NATO standards for military equipment and procedures, verified by NATO assessments; (c) Joint military exercises demonstrating seamless operation; (d) Public acknowledgment of interoperability by NATO officials and documentation in official NATO reports, or credible reports from at least three major news organizations confirming interoperability.

P.title: Will a Formula 1 Grand Prix be hosted in a country currently under international sanctions by 2025?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a Formula 1 Grand Prix is officially scheduled to take place in a country that is currently under international sanctions imposed by recognized authorities such as the United Nations, the European Union, or the United States. The term 'international sanctions' refers to restrictions imposed on a country by the international community, which may include trade restrictions, financial embargoes, and travel bans. The hosting of the Grand Prix must be confirmed by an official announcement from Formula 1 or the relevant governing body. If the event is canceled or relocated for any reason, this question will resolve as No. Temporary or unofficial races do not count towards this resolution.

Q.title: Will a Formula 1 driver participate in a race in a country under international sanctions by 2025?
Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if a Formula 1 driver competes in a race held in a country currently under international sanctions by the end of 2025.

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) A Formula 1 Grand Prix is hosted in a country currently under international sanctions by 2025, and (2) A Formula 1 driver participates in a race in a country under international sanctions by 2025?
P_and_Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, both of the following conditions are met: (1) A Formula 1 Grand Prix is officially scheduled to take place in a country that is currently under international sanctions imposed by recognized authorities such as the United Nations, the European Union, or the United States. The hosting of the Grand Prix must be confirmed by an official announcement from Formula 1 or the relevant governing body. If the event is canceled or relocated for any reason, this condition will resolve as No. Temporary or unofficial races do not count towards this resolution. (2) A Formula 1 driver competes in a race held in a country currently under international sanctions by the end of 2025.
